    Bootstrap Function Modification

    Bootstrap.Rd

    This Bootstrap function will provide you always an object of class bootstrap.

    Bootstrap(x, B = 1000, statistic, sample_size = length(x))

    Arguments

    x

    represent the original sample

    B

    number of bootstrap samples. By default B = 1000

    statistic

    is an indicator of the statistic applied to the samples

    sample_size

    is the length of every bootstrap sample. By default sample_size = "the original sample size"

    Value

    A list of type bootstrap.class composed of relevant values provided by the Bootstrap function:

    theta_hat

    The statistic applied to the original sample

    theta_star

    A list of length B composed of statistics applied to each bootstrapped samples

    varBoot

    The variance applied to theta_star

    Unbiased_estimator

    Unbieased variance of the estimator

    coerced_to_a_vector

    Returning a True or Flase regarding the initial sample if it was coerced to a vector

    stat

    Return the name of the statistic used thruough the Bootstrap function

    B

    Number of bootrsapped samples

    sample_size

    Return the length of every bootstrap sample

    Author

    Group-E

    Examples

    Bootstrap(rnorm(100), statistic = mean)
#> Non-parametric bootstrap estimate of the variance of 'mean'
#> -----------------
#> Variance estimate is 0.009 
#> Based on B=1000 bootstrap replicates
#> and a sample of size: 100
